label: 边崖警探 Agents of Edgewatch

Acidic Poison Cloud Trap.name: Acidic Poison Cloud Trap
Acidic Poison Cloud Trap.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:35|name:Block One Nozzle|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to block one of the nozzles or @Check[type:thievery|dc:40|name:Shut Off the Tank|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to shut off the tank. The trap deactivates after 5 rounds, once the tank is empty.
Acidic Poison Cloud Trap.hazarddescription: Five nozzles hidden across the apartment's ceiling spew thick clouds of acidic poison from a reinforced tank behind the wall.
Acidic Poison Cloud Trap.routine: (1 action) When it's triggered, the trap has five active nozzles, but at the end of its turn each round, one random nozzle deactivates. On the trap's turn, the active nozzles emit a cloud of acidic poison gas that expands to fill the apartment. The cloud deals [[/r {1d6}[acid]]]{1d6 acid damage} and [[/r {1d6}[poison]]]{1d6 poison damage} per active nozzle to each creature and object in the room (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:33|basic:true|name:Spew Cloud|traits:poison] save). Unattended objects automatically fail saves to avoid the damage.

Magic Susceptibility.name: Magic Susceptibility
Magic Susceptibility.description:
An almiraj takes a -2 status penalty to saving throws against occult spells.

Any beneficial occult spells with a duration of 1 round or longer cast on the almiraj last twice as long.

Magic Horn.name: Magic Horn
Magic Horn.description:
Any living creature slain by the almiraj's horn Strike immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Petrified} with no saving throw, in addition to dying.

A severed almiraj horn retains a wisp of its former magic; in combat, the horn can be wielded as a +1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.rQWaJhI5Bko5x14Z]{dagger} or, if affixed to a shaft, a +1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.tOhoGvmCMw4JpWcS]{spear}

Arcane Feedback Trap.name: Arcane Feedback Trap
Arcane Feedback Trap.disable: @Check[type:arcana|dc:33|name:Quell Rippling Stone] (master) to quell the rippling stone or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th level, counteract DC 31) to dispel the magical feedback.
Arcane Feedback Trap.hazarddescription: A spike of stone bursts from the south wall and quickly retracts.

Prickly Defense.name: Prickly Defense
Prickly Defense.description:
The avarek withdraws beneath its spines, presenting a defensive, spiky exterior. It gains a +2 circumstance bonus to spine Strikes and AC. Any adjacent creature that attempts a melee attack against the avarek takes 1d6 piercing damage per attack, regardless of whether the attack hits.

Prickly Defense lasts until the avarek uses a move action or makes a Strike with any weapon other than its spines.

Rolling Assault.name: Rolling Assault
Rolling Assault.description:
The avarek curls into a ball and rolls rapidly, impaling enemies with its spines. The avarek Strides twice and makes up to two spine Strikes at any point during its movement, each against a different target within reach.

These attacks count toward the avarek's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after the avarek makes all the attacks.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
The avarek's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Baatamidar.name: Baatamidar
Baatamidar.publicNotes: Baatamidars are drawn to destroy planar communities on the fringes where the Outer Planes touch the chaos of the Maelstrom. They resemble floating blobs of undulating, prismatic ooze with four quivering tentacles and dribbles of oily slime that always drip upwards.

Tear Flesh.name: Tear Flesh
Tear Flesh.description:
Trigger A creature grabbed by the barnacle ghoul critically fails a skill check to Escape

Effect The barnacle ghoul makes a claw Strike against the triggering creature.

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements The barnacle ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The barnacle ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r {5d6}[healing]]]{5d6 Hit Points}.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

Fill Lungs.name: Fill Lungs
Fill Lungs.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (1 round)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3} (1 round)

Stage 4 drowning and cannot reduce below stage 4 until the water is purged; purging the water requires a successful @Check[type:medicine|dc:26|name:Purge Water|traits:manipulate,action:administer-first-aid] check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid} (which stops the creature from drowning and returns the creature to stage 3; stage 2 on a critical success) or a magical effect that removes curses or the sickened condition (which stops the creature from drowning and ends the curse).

If the creature dies from drowning, it rises as a barnacle ghoul the next midnight.

Nimble Swim.name: Nimble Swim
Nimble Swim.description: The barnacle ghoul Swims up to 20 feet. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Paralysis.name: Paralysis
Paralysis.description:
Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul's attack must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}.

It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

Haphazard Hack.name: Haphazard Hack
Haphazard Hack.description:
Requirements Rekarek is adjacent to two or more enemies

Effect Rekarek makes three melee weapon Strikes, two of which must be against different enemies.

These attacks count toward her multiple attack penalty, but only after all three Strikes have been made.

After taking this activity, Rekarek is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} until the beginning of her next turn.

Delay Condition.name: Delay Condition
Delay Condition.description: The binumir's dual spirit takes longer to be affected by detrimental effects. When the binumir is the target of an effect that imparts the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.9qGBRpbX9NEwtAAr]{Controlled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} condition, the condition is automatically suppressed until the end of the binumir's next turn.

Agonizing Wail.name: Agonizing Wail
Agonizing Wail.description:
The binumir unleashes a distressing cry that fills others with wrenching sadness. Creatures within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:17] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Agonizing Wail for 1 minute.

Success The target can't use reactions for 1 round.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions for 1 minute as it sobs uncontrollably. It can attempt a new Will save to end the effect at the end of each of its turns.

Critical Failure As failure, but the target can't make saves to end the effect.

Dual Assault.name: Dual Assault
Dual Assault.description:
The binumir makes four Strikes; no more than two can be against the same target.

These attacks count toward the binumir's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks have been made.

Blackfinger's Prayer.name: Blackfinger's Prayer
Blackfinger's Prayer.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:50|name:Gum Up Trapdoor|traits:action:disable-a-device] (legendary) to gum up the trapdoor's porous metal surface, @Check[type:crafting|dc:45|name:Render Toxin Inert] (master) to render the toxin inert, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level; counteract DC 45) to counteract the trap's magic
Blackfinger's Prayer.hazarddescription: The trapdoor's metal is infused with a deadly toxin that seeps out when the trap is triggered.

Concussive Beatdown.name: Concussive Beatdown
Concussive Beatdown.description:
Requirements Berleth has just used his shovel to Trip a creature

Effect Berleth brutally brings his shovel down on the prone foe, making a shovel Strike. On a hit, the Strike deals damage as normal, plus the target must make a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:30] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 minute.

Decapitate.name: Decapitate
Decapitate.description:
Berleth plunges his shovel through a creature's neck as though it were peat moss.

He makes a shovel Strike against an adjacent @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} creature. On a hit, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded 2} (possibly @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying}).

Final Blow.name: Final Blow
Final Blow.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger Berleth is reduced to 0 HP

Effect Berleth makes a final shovel Strike before dying.

Boiling Fountains.name: Boiling Fountains
Boiling Fountains.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:21|name:Disable Pressure Plate|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to disable each pressure plate, @Check[type:thievery|dc:16|name:Jam Fountain|traits:action:disable-a-device] to jam each fountain, or @Check[type:thievery|dc:18|name:Deflect Fountain's Spray|traits:action:disable-a-device] to deflect a fountain's spray
Boiling Fountains.hazarddescription: Four pressure plates beneath the floorboards activate dragon-headed fountains on either side of the room, which spray boiling water across the area between them.
Boiling Fountains.reset: Once a pressure plate has been activated, it must be reset manually.

Boiling Tub Trap.name: Boiling Tub Trap
Boiling Tub Trap.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:32|name:Remove Trip Wire|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to safely remove the trip wire from the bomb
Boiling Tub Trap.hazarddescription: A snapped trip wire causes an alchemical bomb to detonate and blow up part of the tin tub, spilling boiling water all over the trap's victim.

Rage.name: Rage
Rage.description:
Requirements Bolar isn't fatigued or raging

Effect Bolar gains 3 temporary Hit Points that last until the rage ends. While raging, he deals 2 additional damage with melee attacks and takes a -1 penalty to AC. The rage lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies Bolar can perceive, or until Bolar falls unconscious.

Once the rage ends, Bolar can't Rage again for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Effect: Rage}

Bone Skipper Swarm.name: Bone Skipper Swarm
Bone Skipper Swarm.senses: bonesense (模糊感官) 30 尺, 黑暗视觉

Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet
Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: A bone skipper swarm identifies bones and creatures with a skeletal system in the listed range.

Marrow Rot.name: Marrow Rot
Marrow Rot.description:
Marrow rot affects only creatures with a skeletal system

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Swarming Bites.name: Swarming Bites
Swarming Bites.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes [[/r {3d6}[piercing]]]{3d6 piercing damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:24|basic:true]) save plus exposure to marrow rot.

Partial Amphibian.name: Partial Amphibian
Partial Amphibian.description: The bregdi can breathe air for up to 10 minutes, or up to an hour so long as its skin remains wet.

Capsize.name: Capsize
Capsize.description: The bregdi tries to capsize an adjacent aquatic vessel of its size or smaller. It must succeed at an Athletics check with a DC of 35 (reduced by 5 for each size smaller the vessel is than the bregdi) or the pilot's Sailing Lore DC, whichever is higher.

Tug.name: Tug
Tug.description:
The bregdi pulls a creature it can reach or a creature holding something it can reach (such as a fishing line in the water).

The bregdi attempts an Athletics check against the creature's Fortitude DC. On a success, it pulls the creature into an adjacent space. On a critical success, the bregdi can also make a jaws Strike against the creature pulled into an adjacent space.

Burning Chandelier Trap.name: Burning Chandelier Trap
Burning Chandelier Trap.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:36|name:Disable a Chandelier|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to disable a chandelier or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 33) to permanently drain the magic from a chandelier. Any amount of cold damage that overcomes a chandelier's cold resistance extinguishes its flames and removes its persistent fire damage and flame dart attack. @Check[type:thievery|dc:41|name:Disable Trap (Control Panel)|traits:action:disable-a-device] (legendary) to disable the entire trap from the hidden control panel in the southeast corner of the room.
Burning Chandelier Trap.hazarddescription: Four large flaming chandeliers swing wildly around the room.
Burning Chandelier Trap.reset: The trap deactivates and resets 1 minute after there are no living creatures remaining in the room.
Burning Chandelier Trap.routine: (4 actions) For every chandelier disabled, the trap's actions are reduced by 1. For each of the trap's actions, a different chandelier attacks a random creature in the room. A chandelier uses its swinging chandelier attack if it can, but it can't make melee attacks against creatures in the cage, the closet, or the gap between the two double doors leading into the vault. Against a creature it can't reach with a melee attack, it uses a flame dart attack instead. The trap doesn't take multiple attack penalties.
Burning Chandelier Trap.stealthdetails: (master) or @Check[type:perception|dc:38|traits:action:seek] (master) to spot the trap's control panel

Canopy Drop.name: Canopy Drop
Canopy Drop.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:23|name:Jam Trapdoor Mechanism|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to jam the mechanisms and keep the trapdoor from opening, or to locate the bypass switch hidden under a stair riser just outside the room
Canopy Drop.hazarddescription: A trapdoor, connected to floor sensors, opens in the section of floor marked on the map, while the surrounding floor suddenly tilts to a 45-degree angle and the fountains in the wall begin spraying at high pressure, making the tile slippery and pushing creatures toward the open chute.

Carvey.name: Carvey
Carvey.publicNotes: Made of odd scraps of skin and muscle, a flesh golem is a grotesque parody of life. Though it has no mind, it can still go into a berserk rage when harmed, giving it a faint semblance of emotion. Flesh golems guard the laboratories and charnel houses of fleshwarpers and necromancers who feel no compunctions about desecrating corpses for their own ends. Though the first flesh golem is believed to have been a misguided attempt to create from simple base elements, these monstrosities are far from human. In isolated cases, echoes of a personality might rise in a flesh golem if the brain used as part of its construction belonged to a particularly powerful personality, but such tragic instances are rare in the extreme.

Suicidal Obedience.name: Suicidal Obedience
Suicidal Obedience.description:
Carvey is unerringly loyal to the Skinsaw cult and to Mobana especially. When Carvey goes berserk, she doesn't attack the nearest living creature or object but instead moves adjacent to the creature nearest the balcony (or similar falling hazard, if the battle is taking place elsewhere) and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} the creature over the cliff's edge.

The number of feet Carvey can Shove a creature is doubled as long as Carvey has 40 or fewer HP (thus, she pushes a creature 10 feet on a sucessful check and 20 feet on a critical success), but she must move the same distance and in the same direction as the pushed creature.

If the shoved creature falls over the cliff's edge, so does Carvey.

Berserk.name: Berserk
Berserk.description:
A severely damaged flesh golem has a chance of going berserk.

If it has 40 or fewer HP at the start of its turn, the golem must succeed at a @Check[type:flat|dc:5] check or go berserk. A berserk golem wildly attacks the nearest living creature, or the nearest object if no creatures are nearby.

Electric Reflexes.name: Electric Reflexes
Electric Reflexes.description:
Trigger The golem takes electricity damage and a creature is adjacent to it.

Effect The golem lashes out and tries to grab a nearby creature. The golem attempts an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} an adjacent creature. The creature also takes [[/r {3d6}[electricity]]]{3d6 electricity damage} on a success, or [[/r {6d6}[electricity]]]{6d6 electricity damage} on a critical success.

Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
Golem Antimagic.description:
harmed by fire ([[/r 5d8]], [[/r 3d4]] from areas or persistent damage); healed by electricity (area [[/r {2d4}[healing]]]{2d4 Hit Points}); slowed by cold

A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. If an entry lists multiple types (such as "cold and water"), either type of spell can affect the golem.

Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical.

Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical.

Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/br 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6 rounds} instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for that round.

Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.

Vulnerable to Flesh to Stone.name: Vulnerable to Flesh to Stone
Vulnerable to Flesh to Stone.description: Casting a flesh to stone spell on the flesh golem affects the golem normally.

Berserk Slam.name: Berserk Slam
Berserk Slam.description:
Requirement The flesh golem is berserk.

Effect The flesh golem Strikes with its fist at a -1 circumstance penalty. If it hits, it deals [[/r 1d6]] extra damage and knocks the target @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Escort from the Premises.name: Escort from the Premises
Escort from the Premises.description:
Requirements The casino bouncer has Grabbed a Medium or smaller target and is wielding a nonlethal weapon in the other hand

Effect The casino bouncer makes a Strike against the grabbed target with the nonlethal weapon. If the Strike hits, it deals damage as usual and the casino bouncer moves the target 5 feet (this is forced movement) and Steps into the space the target had just occupied.

Intimidating Stare.name: Intimidating Stare
Intimidating Stare.description:
The casino bouncer attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.nEwqNNWX6scLt4sc]{Demoralize} a creature with a mere glance. The casino bouncer doesn't take a penalty to their Intimidation check if the target doesn't speak the same language.

If the bouncer rolls a critical success, the target can't reduce the value of its frightened condition until [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} have passed.

Chalky.name: Chalky
Chalky.publicNotes: This golem is a walking alchemical nightmare capable of inflicting all manner of painful wounds. Its ability to follow orders is granted by the otherwise mindless humanoid brain that floats in its dome-like head. In exceptionally rare cases, the brain used in its creation might retain fragments of memories or even actual intellect, resulting in an alchemical golem with a personality and agenda of its own.

Alchemical Chambers.name: Alchemical Chambers
Alchemical Chambers.description:
An alchemical golem's body contains six alchemical chambers filled with different substances. When an alchemical golem ability calls upon a randomly determined alchemical effect, roll 1d6 and consult the following :

[[/r {1d6} #Alchemical Effect]]{1d6} Alchemical Effect
1

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.TZUskLT7yvP7N2co]{Elixir of Life (Lesser)}
2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.T4ouD4mVFHA3EHs6]{Bomber's Eye Elixir (Lesser)}
3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.oCuwJ9IUDAuzsUwa]{Bravo's Brew (Moderate)}
4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.bQPRKEpnLakJBAAh]{Cat's Eye Elixir}
5 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.AqLxu3ir4UGzdOaz]{Cheetah's Elixir (Moderate)}
6 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.TMtQnY6yvIRCpK9v]{Juggernaut Mutagen (Greater)}

Alchemical Rupture.name: Alchemical Rupture
Alchemical Rupture.description:
When an alchemical golem takes physical damage from a critical hit or is affected by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter} spell, one glass chamber within its body shatters, spewing alchemical liquid in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5].

Roll on the alchemical chambers list to determine which one shatters - all creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] are affected by the elixir in the randomly rolled alchemical chamber, and these creatures may forego their Reflex saves against the effect if they wish.

Golem Antimagic.name: Golem Antimagic
Golem Antimagic.description:
harmed by sonic ([[/r 5d8]], [[/r 2d6]] from areas or persistent damage; healed by acid (area [[/r {2d4}[healing]]]{2d4 Hit Points}); slowed by cold

A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. If an entry lists multiple types (such as “cold and water”), either type of spell can affect the golem.

Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical.

Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical.

Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/br 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6 rounds} instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for that round.

Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.

Vulnerable to Shatter.name: Vulnerable to Shatter
Vulnerable to Shatter.description: Casting a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.1xbFBQDRs0hT5xZ9]{Shatter} spell on an alchemical golem affects the golem normally, but also causes an alchemical rupture.

Alchemical Injection.name: Alchemical Injection
Alchemical Injection.description: When an alchemical golem hits a creature with a syringe Strike, roll 1d6 on the alchemical chambers list to determine the additional effect of the attack. The syringe deals an additional [[/r 2d6]] damage of the appropriate type.

Clockwork Arms.name: Clockwork Arms
Clockwork Arms.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:43|name:Deactivate One Arm|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to jam and deactivate one of the arms or @Check[type:athletics|dc:46|name:Tear Arm Off Machine] (legendary) to tear an arm off the machine.
Clockwork Arms.hazarddescription: Four claw-tipped clockwork arms suspended from the ceiling pick up and deposit creatures into a nearby hatch.
Clockwork Arms.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action per arm destroyed or disabled. On its turn, the trap makes claw Strikes against creatures other than the Rumormonger or the Inkmaster. If an arm already has a creature grabbed, the trap spends 2 actions to use its Open Hatch ability.

Clockwork Poison Bomb.name: Clockwork Poison Bomb
Clockwork Poison Bomb.disable: Three @Check[type:thievery|dc:31|name:Disable a Latch|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable a Device} to disable the latches that lock the nozzle in place, then one @Check[type:thievery|dc:35|name:Turn Off Nozzle|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) check to Disable a Device to turn off the nozzle; DCs decrease by 2 if Oggvurm is immobilized, paralyzed, unconscious, or dead
Clockwork Poison Bomb.hazarddescription: A clockwork bomb releases gouts of poisonous smoke. The smoke issues forth from a single nozzle attached to two tanks of pressurized poison
Clockwork Poison Bomb.reset: The trap issues smoke for 3 minutes before its tanks run dry. The tanks must be replaced before the bomb can be reactivated.
Clockwork Poison Bomb.routine: (1 action) On its turn, the bomb spews forth a smoky gout of airborne @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.WvDbdESFJY6Be2u1]{Blackfinger Blight} poison. The cloud fills a 20-foot radius, or a 10-foot radius if only one tank remains intact. If the bomb is already in the center of a blackfinger blight cloud, the radius of that cloud increases by 20 feet (or 10 feet, if only one tank remains intact) instead.
Clockwork Poison Bomb.stealthdetails: The bomb uses Oggvurm's initiative roll as its Stealth roll

26ZZztmP0cFmWp6x.name: precise tremorsense 40 尺
26ZZztmP0cFmWp6x.description:
The cobbleswarm's tremorsense is a precise sense out to 40 feet and an imprecise sense out to 80 feet. The cobbleswarm can't sense anything beyond the range of its tremorsense.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Tremorsense]

Grasping Bites.name: Grasping Bites
Grasping Bites.description:
The cobbleswarm attempts an Athletics check and compares the result to the Fortitude DC of all creatures in its space.

Critical Success The creature falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and takes [[/r {1d6}[bludgeoning]]]{1d6 bludgeoning damage}, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the cobbleswarm until the end of the cobbleswarm's next turn.

Success The creature falls prone, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the cobbleswarm until the creature until the end of the cobbleswarm's next turn.

Pummeling Assault.name: Pummeling Assault
Pummeling Assault.description: Each enemy in the cobbleswarm's space takes [[/r {2d4}[bludgeoning]]]{2d4 bludgeoning damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true] save).

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
The Copper Hand illusionist deals 2d6 additional precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger A creature targets the Copper Hand rogue with an attack, and the rogue can see the attacker

Effect The rogue dodges out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Poison Weapon.name: Poison Weapon
Poison Weapon.description: The rogue applies one of their black adder venom poisons to their wielded weapon. If their next attack with that weapon before the end of their next turn hits and deals damage, the target is afflicted with the poison.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
The Copper Hand rogue deals 1d6 additional precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Dart Barrage.name: Dart Barrage
Dart Barrage.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:22|name:Disable Pressure Plate|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to disable the pressure plate, or four @Check[type:thievery|dc:18|name:Plug Dart Launcher|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) checks to plug the dart launchers
Dart Barrage.hazarddescription: Four dart-loaded pipes hidden in the diagonal walls are connected to a pressure plate under the brass seal in the room's center.
Dart Barrage.reset: The trap runs out of darts after 4 rounds of firing and must be reset manually by dismantling the walls to reload the launchers. If at any point there are no longer more than two creatures placing weight on the floor, the trap ceases firing but remains armed, ready to resume firing its remaining darts once triggered again.
Dart Barrage.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action for each disabled launcher. On each of the trap's actions, it fires one dart at a creature in the center of the room.
Dart Barrage.stealthdetails: (trained) or @Check[type:perception|dc:23|traits:action:seek] (trained) to notice scratches around the musical pipes and a slight give to the seal

strike-Moderate Acid Flask.name: 中等强酸瓶 Moderate Acid Flask

strike-Moderate Alchemist's Fire.name: 中等炽火胶 Moderate Alchemist's Fire

Dirty Bomb.name: Dirty Bomb
Dirty Bomb.description:
Requirements The chemist has at least one bomb in their possession

Effect The chemist adds a hasty mix of noxious substances to the bomb and makes a ranged Strike with it. If it hits and deals damage, the target must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for [[/br 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds}; if the result of the save is a critical failure, this increases to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3}. For the next 24 hours, the affected target takes a -2 circumstance penalty (-3 on a critical failure) to additional Fortitude saving throws against the same chemist's Crude Bombs.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.5ZK22sNW7o26aST0]{Effect: Dirty Bomb}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.ryY6fdqpC5Ztnagd]{Effect: Dirty Bomb (Critical Failure)}

Quick Brew.name: Quick Brew
Quick Brew.description:
Requirements The chemist has their alchemist's tools, formula book, and a free hand

Effect The chemist creates a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Moderate Acid Flask} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.gWr4q4HiyGhETA8H]{Alchemist's Fire} that they must use before the end of their next turn or else it becomes inert.

Bullyrag Beatdown.name: Bullyrag Beatdown
Bullyrag Beatdown.description: Whenever the gang tough makes a successful melee Strike against a frightened creature, the Strike deals an extra weapon die of damage.

Frightening Critical.name: Frightening Critical
Frightening Critical.description: When the gang tough's Strike with a bludgeoning weapon is a critical hit and deals damage, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
Quick Bomber.description: The Diobel Sweeper tough Interacts to draw a bomb, then Strikes with it.

Dreadsong Dancer.name: Dreadsong Dancer
Dreadsong Dancer.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. composition spells

+2 status to all saves vs. composition s.name: +2 status to all saves vs. composition spells

Jealous Musician.name: Jealous Musician
Jealous Musician.description:
Trigger A creature plays an instrument while Casting a Spell or casts a composition spell within 20 feet of the dreadsong dancer

Effect The dreadsong dancer Strides up to 20 feet and makes a songblade Strike against the triggering creature. If the Strike hits, the spell is disrupted.

Performance Anxiety.name: Performance Anxiety
Performance Anxiety.description:
A dreadsong dancer is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} if they see or hear a creature critically succeed at a Performance check or at a saving throw against their Dreadsong.

The dreadsong dancer is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened 1} for 1 round if they see or hear a creature critically fail at a Performance check or a saving throw against their Dreadsong.

They can use the extra action only to Stride or Strike.

Dreadsong.name: Dreadsong
Dreadsong.description:
The dreadsong dancer whirls their howling songblades and cloaks themself in illusion magic. Each non-fiend creature in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] from the dreadsong dancer must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:29] save.

Critical Success No effect, and the creature is temporarily immune for 24 hours. The dreadsong dancer is affected by their performance anxiety.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}, and the dreadsong dancer is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} by the creature for 1 minute. The creature can't use Seek to find the dreadsong dancer.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature can't reduce its frightened condition below 2 for 1 minute. In addition, the dreadsong dancer is affected by its performance anxiety.

Arrogant Taunts.name: Arrogant Taunts
Arrogant Taunts.description:
The eberark utters crude insults and growls threateningly. Each creature within 30 feet must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:27] save.

The creature is then temporarily immune for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4} and paralyzed for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Incendiary Spit.name: Incendiary Spit
Incendiary Spit.description:
A creature hit by the eberark's spit becomes coated in a slippery, flammable oil.

The creature must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:27] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as they are coated in incendiary spit.

Creatures affected by incendiary spit that take fire damage catch fire, taking [[/r {3d6}[persistent,fire]]] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Fire Damage}. Once this persistent fire damage ends, the spit has burned away.

Trail of Flame.name: Trail of Flame
Trail of Flame.description:
The eberark Strides twice, leaving a trail of magical fire behind it as it moves. Squares the eberark moves through catch fire, creating a 5-foot-tall wall of flame that burns for 1 round. The wall of flame conceals creatures and objects on the other side of it.

Any creature that enters or starts its turn in the wall of flame takes [[/r {6d6}[fire]]]{6d6 fire damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:27|basic:true] save).

Vein Walker.name: Vein Walker
Vein Walker.description: The excorion moves about by way of hundreds of pulsating blood vessels, which stretch from its body in dozens of tight, ropy bundles and anchor it to the ground. An excorion cannot be Tripped, Shoved, or otherwise forcibly moved except by magic, and the excorion ignores difficult terrain (but not greater difficult terrain).

Bloody Handprint.name: Bloody Handprint
Bloody Handprint.description: The excorion plants a magical handprint on the target, marking them as chosen for death. The excorion makes a fist Strike against an adjacent creature; this does not count toward the excorion's multiple attack penalty. On a hit, the attack does no damage, but the creature becomes observed to every excorion within 60 feet, even if an excorion's line of sight would be blocked by a wall or other obstacle. This effect lasts until the handprint is washed off, which requires water and spending 3 actions to fully clean off.

Vital Transfusion.name: Vital Transfusion
Vital Transfusion.description:
Requirements The excorion has at least 70 Hit Points

Effect The excorion sacrifices itself and transfers its bloody, vital energy to a willing living creature within 30 feet. The excorion is immediately destroyed, and the targeted living creature heals a number of HP equal to half the excorion's remaining HP at the time that it used this ability.

The living creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} during its next turn as its body adjusts to the newly transfused blood and vital energy; the living creature also counts as an excorion for 1 minute for the purpose of seeing other excorions' Bloody Handprint marks.

Vomit Blood.name: Vomit Blood
Vomit Blood.description: The excorion spews necrotic blood all over a foe it has grabbed. The grabbed creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}.

Exploding Statue.name: Exploding Statue
Exploding Statue.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:21|name:Safely Cut Wire|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to safely cut the wire
Exploding Statue.hazarddescription: A hollow statue filled with explosives is connected to a trip wire running along the adjacent door.

Explosive Barrels.name: Explosive Barrels
Explosive Barrels.disable: @Check[type:survival|dc:20|name:Smother the Flames] to smother the flames without rupturing the barrels
Explosive Barrels.hazarddescription: Wooden barrels marked with an oil-drop symbol catch fire and explode.

Eyeball Tank.name: Eyeball Tank
Eyeball Tank.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:38|name:Acidify Slime|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) or @Check[type:crafting|dc:34|name:Acidify Slime] (expert) to acidify the slime inside the tank, destroying the eyeballs
Eyeball Tank.hazarddescription: A vat of thick glass stands 10 feet high and is filled with green slime and fist-sized eyeballs.
Eyeball Tank.routine: (3 actions) Each round, the vat uses all three of its actions to shoot random eye rays at any living creatures (except Ixusoth) in range.

False Door Trap.name: False Door Trap
False Door Trap.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:32|name:Jam Needle in Housing|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to jam the needle in its housing or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (6th level, counteract DC 30) to dispel the magical poison.
False Door Trap.hazarddescription: A hidden needle delivers a magical poison to anyone trying to open the door.

equipment-Jade Bauble (affixed to Main-G.name: 翡翠雕饰 Jade Bauble (附着于格挡匕首)
equipment-Jade Bauble (affixed to Main-G.description:
用法 附着到一件近战武器

启动 A 命令

需求 你在附着的武器上达到大师

这块翡翠通常被雕刻成一个决斗者的形状，有时也会雕刻成一个多武装的生物。当你启动这块雕饰，它魔法般地吸引了对手的注意力。直到你下一回合开始，在护符附着的武器的触及范围内的敌人陷入措手不及。

Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger A creature targets Fayati with an attack and she can see the attacker

Effect Fayati dodges out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Opportune Backstab.name: Opportune Backstab
Opportune Backstab.description:
Trigger A creature within Fayati's reach is hit by a melee Strike from one of her allies

Effect Fayati makes a Strike against the triggering creature.

Deepen the Wound.name: Deepen the Wound
Deepen the Wound.description:
Requirements Fayati's last attack was a successful melee Strike with her rapier

Effect Fayati makes a main-gauche Strike against the same creature that she just hit. This Strike deals an additional [[/r {4d6}[precision]]]{4d6 precision damage}.

Guildmaster's Lead.name: Guildmaster's Lead
Guildmaster's Lead.description:
Whenever Fayati critically succeeds at a Strike against a creature, until the start of her next turn, the first time that another member of the Copper Hand deals damage to that creature during their turn, they deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to it.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.dVVc5MYx4G3QPHoa]{Effect: Guildmaster's Lead}

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
Fayati deals 2d6 extra precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Field Of Opposition.name: Field Of Opposition
Field Of Opposition.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:42|name:Disable Thievery] (legendary) to permanently disable the planar distortion (DC increases by 2 for each duplicate still extant), or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (10th level; counteract DC 42) to destroy the planar distortion
Field Of Opposition.hazarddescription: A distortion in space spawns an aggressive, malevolent shadow duplicate of any characters who pass between Terimor's faces.

Flying Guillotine.name: Flying Guillotine
Flying Guillotine.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|name:Erase Glyph|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to erase the glyph (which requires a successful unarmed attack roll if the blade is already active) or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd level; counteract DC 20) to counteract it. The trap has a secret bypass known only to Ralso and Pratchett: as long as the guillotine can see a creature in the room touching thumb and pinky together with an empty hand, it remains dormant.
Flying Guillotine.hazarddescription: An invisible magical glyph on the guillotine's blade detects living creatures in the room, which causes the guillotine to fly off its hinges and attack.
Flying Guillotine.reset: After 1 minute, the trap deactivates, though the door remains locked. The trap rearms itself each day at dawn.
Flying Guillotine.routine: (1 action) The blade @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Flies} up to 20 feet and Strikes any creatures whose squares it passes through. It cannot target the same creature more than once per round. The blade cannot be grappled and doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.

Franca Laurentz.name: Franca Laurentz
Franca Laurentz.senses: +2 circumstance bonus to saves vs. poison

+2 circumstance bonus on saves vs. poiso.name: +2 circumstance bonus on saves vs. poison

Deflective Dodge.name: Deflective Dodge
Deflective Dodge.description:
Trigger The attack roll for a Strike targeting Franca fails or critically fails

Effect Franca can choose to either Step or redirect the attack to a creature that is adjacent to her and within the reach of the triggering attack.

The attacker rerolls the Strike's attack roll against the new target.

Bloody Rebel.name: Bloody Rebel
Bloody Rebel.description:
Franca quickly slashes at nearby foes, aiming to maim rather than disable. She makes up to three melee Strikes, each against a different creature within reach.

These Strikes count toward Franca's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after all three Strikes are made.

On a hit, the Strike deals [[/r {3}[persistent,bleed]]] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage} instead of its normal damage.

On a critical hit, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} until the beginning of Franca's next turn or until they spend an action to remove the condition, whichever comes first.

Hamstring.name: Hamstring
Hamstring.description:
Requirements Franca's last action was a melee Strike that dealt sneak attack damage to a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} target

Effect Franca deals [[/r {6}[persistent,bleed]]] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage} to the target creature, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
Franca's Strikes deal an additional 3d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Splash Poison.name: Splash Poison
Splash Poison.description:
Franca uncorks and flings a dose of poison at a bleeding foe.

She retrieves a poison from her inventory, then splashes it at a creature within 10 feet that is currently taking @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}.

The creature must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:32] save or be exposed to the poison.

Freezing Alarm.name: Freezing Alarm
Freezing Alarm.disable: @Check[type:arcana|dc:53|name:Disable Arcana] (legendary) to draw a fiery counteracting glyph over each snowflake, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level, counteract DC 48)
Freezing Alarm.hazarddescription: Miniature snowflake-shaped glyphs on the ground cause a layer of ice to ripple over the floor of the room and sound a silent alarm.

equipment-Alietta (+1 Striking Bastard S.name: Alietta (+1 Striking Bastard Sword)
equipment-Alietta (+1 Striking Bastard S.description: This broad-bladed sword, sometimes called the hand-and-a-half sword, has a longer grip so it can be held in one hand or used with two hands to provide extra piercing or slashing power.

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description:
When Frefferth is destroyed, his body and items dissipate into shadowy nothingness and the knight re-forms after [[/r 1d4 #days]]{1d4 days} within the sarcophagus in area D12, fully healed.

Frefferth can be trapped only by returning the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.6MIBHKMJmD8uQVam]{Chain of the Stilled Spirit} to the sarcophagus (see areas D12 and D34), in which case Frefferth's body dissipates, leaving his items in the spot where he was last slain.

Head Hunter.name: Head Hunter
Head Hunter.description:
Any slashing weapon a dullahan wields becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.hg3IogR8ue2IWwgS]{Keen}, and any hatchet it wields becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.qlunQzfnzPQpMG6U]{Returning}.

If the dullahan kills a creature with a critical hit using a slashing weapon, the target is decapitated as though the dullahan had used Reap on the target.

These effects remain only while the dullahan holds the weapon.

Impaler.name: Impaler
Impaler.description:
Whenever Frefferth damages a creature with a critical hit using a ranged piercing weapon, the weapon remains impaled in the victim's body.

The victim becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} as long as they are impaled; the impaling weapon can be removed by the affected creature or an adjacent ally as a 2-action activity that has the manipulate trait.

Reap.name: Reap
Reap.description:
Frefferth removes the head of a dead creature within reach.

Each creature within the area of Frefferth's frightful presence must attempt a new save, even if they are temporarily immune.

Summon Steed.name: Summon Steed
Summon Steed.description:
Frefferth summons a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.waPgKbjhijeZ00Zm]{Nightmare}.

This steed remains until it is slain, Frefferth @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.AjLSHZSWQ90exdLo]{Dismisses} it, or Frefferth summons another steed.

Charming Liar.name: Charming Liar
Charming Liar.description:
When Gage gets a critical success using the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.VTg4t8kYTvXcHROq]{Lie} action, the target's attitude toward him improves by one step, as though he'd succeeded at using Diplomacy to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}.

This works only once per conversation, and if he critically succeeds against multiple targets using the same result, he chooses one creature's attitude to improve.

To use this ability, Gage must be lying to impart seemingly important information, inflate his status, or ingratiate himself, which trivial or irrelevant lies can't achieve.

Smooth Operator.name: Smooth Operator
Smooth Operator.description:
When Gage meets a group of up to five people, he can immediately attempt a Diplomacy check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.1Sj2Pz3VI2SFWqZw]{Make an Impression}, comparing the result to the Will DC of each target.

He takes a -3 penalty on this check, and it is possible to get different degrees of success for each target. If he fails or critically fails, he can engage in 1 minute of conversation and attempt a new check at the end of that time rather than accepting the failure or critical failure result.

Bullyrag Beatdown.name: Bullyrag Beatdown
Bullyrag Beatdown.description: Whenever the gang tough makes a successful melee Strike against a frightened creature, the Strike deals an extra weapon die of damage.

Frightening Critical.name: Frightening Critical
Frightening Critical.description: When the gang tough's Strike with a bludgeoning weapon is a critical hit and deals damage, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Gas Trap.name: Gas Trap
Gas Trap.disable: Four @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|name:Block Gas Vents|traits:action:disable-a-device] checks to block the gas vents, or a @Check[type:thievery|dc:26|name:Unlock Door|traits:action:pick-a-lock] check to unlock the door and escape
Gas Trap.hazarddescription: A spring slams and locks the room's door before four hidden gas vents begin pumping poison gas into the chamber.
Gas Trap.reset: The trap must be manually rearmed by unblocking the vents or replacing the poison gas tank in area E30.
Gas Trap.routine:
(1 action) Each round on its initiative count, the trap pumps more toxic gas into the room.

Any breathing creature in the room takes [[/r {4d6}[poison]]]{4d6 poison damage} (a successful @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22|traits:poison,damaging-effect] save halves the damage taken). If a creature acts before the trap on the first round, it has the option of holding its breath to postpone taking damage from the trap-holding one's breath after the trap's first action has no effect, since the air in the creature's lungs is already tainted. Locating and blocking one of the hidden gas vents reduces the poison damage by 1d6-if all four are blocked, the trap is disabled, though the door remains locked. Otherwise, the trap functions for 1 minute before all the gas is expended and characters in the room cease taking damage, after which the trap ventilates the room for 1 additional minute.
Gas Trap.stealthdetails: (trained) to smell the poison gas or hear it hissing

Giant Bone Skipper.name: Giant Bone Skipper
Giant Bone Skipper.senses: bonesense (模糊感官) 30 尺, 黑暗视觉

Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet
Bonesense (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: A giant bone skipper identifies bones and creatures with a skeletal system in the listed range.

Leaping Charge.name: Leaping Charge
Leaping Charge.description: The giant bone skipper @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leaps} up to 20 feet. It then makes a mandibles Strike, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to its attack roll.

Marrow Rot.name: Marrow Rot
Marrow Rot.description:
Marrow rot affects only creatures with a skeletal system

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25|traits:disease]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Greater Planar Rift.name: Greater Planar Rift
Greater Planar Rift.disable: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level; counteract DC 46) to seal the rift
Greater Planar Rift.hazarddescription: A ragged planar rift drags things into its depths and hurls creatures through from its terminal end.

Cheek Pouches.name: Cheek Pouches
Cheek Pouches.description: A ratfolk has stretchy cheek pouches that can store up to 1 cubic foot of objects. The ratfolk can remove or store an item using the Interact action. As long as the ratfolk has at least one object in its cheek pouches, its speech is noticeably difficult to understand.

Katar Specialist.name: Katar Specialist
Katar Specialist.description: Gref has trained extensively with the katar blade. Any katar he wields gains the finesse trait.

Quick Stow.name: Quick Stow
Quick Stow.description:
Frequency once per round.

Effect Gref stores one held item of light or negligible Bulk in his cheek pouches.

Swarming.name: Swarming
Swarming.description:
A ratfolk can end its movement in the same square as an ally that also has this ability.

Only two such creatures can share the same space.

Unbalancing Blow.name: Unbalancing Blow
Unbalancing Blow.description: Any creature a grick critically hits is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} against its attacks until the end of the grick's next turn.

Vermicular Movement.name: Vermicular Movement
Vermicular Movement.description: When a grick takes a Stride action to move half its Speed or less, that movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Furious Pacifier.name: Furious Pacifier
Furious Pacifier.description: Lavarsus adds double his Strength modifier to any nonlethal melee Strikes he makes with a bludgeoning weapon.

Nonlethal Training.name: Nonlethal Training
Nonlethal Training.description:
Lavarsus has trained to take down suspects without killing them.

He can choose to make nonlethal attacks with any bludgeoning weapon without taking the usual penalty to his attack roll.

Grunka.name: Grunka
Grunka.publicNotes:
The frontline fighters of goblin tribes prefer to fight in large groups-especially when they can outnumber their foes at least three to one.

These small humanoids have green or gray skin and large heads with wide ears. While some goblins are civilized and have worked hard to be considered upstanding members of humanoid communities, most are impetuous and vicious creatures who delight in wreaking havoc. These goblins think nothing of slaughtering livestock, stealing infants, or burning down a building purely for momentary delight. They revel in playing malicious tricks on taller humanoids, whom they call "longshanks."

Goblins are superstitious, with an intense awe of magic and a fascination with fire; goblins who master magic or fire earn great respect from their kin. Most other humanoids find it difficult to understand goblins' outlook: they hate canines but eagerly share their lairs with so-called "goblin dogs," they fearlessly attack larger creatures but are terrified of horses, and they despise vegetables yet consider pickles a delicacy. To a goblin, of course, these are all perfectly sensible life choices.

Goblin Scuttle.name: Goblin Scuttle
Goblin Scuttle.description:
Trigger A goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to Grunka.

Effect Grunka @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Steps}.

Hands Of The Forgotten.name: Hands Of The Forgotten
Hands Of The Forgotten.disable: @Check[type:religion|dc:30|name:Exorcise Spirits] (master) to exorcise the spirits or @Check[type:intimidation|dc:32|name:Scare Away the Hands|traits:action:demoralize] (expert) to scare away the hands
Hands Of The Forgotten.hazarddescription: Ethereal hands stretch out from the walls and floor, attempting to restrain nearby creatures.

equipment-Reaper's Lancet (Bonded Item).name: Reaper's Lancet (Bonded Item)
equipment-Reaper's Lancet (Bonded Item).description:
Hendrid Pratchett himself designed this custom skull-topped +1 striking exquisite sword cane and had it gilded in high-quality gold. Its first victim was the very smith whom Pratchett commissioned to craft the weapon, so the means of its construction are a secret known only to Pratchett. The magic of the Reaper's Lancet applies to both the blade and the sheath, making them each effectively a +1 striking weapon, but only if both are wielded by the same creature-if the two components are shared between creatures, only the blade retains the rune's magic.

Reaper's Lancet has a hidden reservoir inside the skull that automatically applies a new dose of poison to the blade after the previous dose was expended with a successful Strike. The reservoir must be filled manually (a process requiring 1 minute) and is large enough to hold only 3 doses at a time. Any sort of injury-delivered poison can be placed in it, though all doses must be of the same poison. The Price of the poison is not reflected in this weapon's listed Price.

Activate R Interact

Trigger You damage a creature with Reaper's Lancet

Effect You poison the creature you hit with the poison currently in the reservoir.

equipment-Hunting Spider Venom (in Reape.name: Hunting Spider Venom (in Reaper's Lancet)
equipment-Hunting Spider Venom (in Reape.description:
This venom erodes its target's defenses, aiding the spider in securing prey.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21|name:Hunting Spider Venom]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {1d10}[poison]]]{1d10 poison damage} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {1d12}[poison]]]{1d12 poison damage}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, and flat-footed (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r {2d6}[poison]]]{2d6 poison damage}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, and flat-footed (1 round)

Sword Cane Duelist.name: Sword Cane Duelist
Sword Cane Duelist.description: Each round, Pratchett can Strike once with each component of a sword cane without incurring the usual multiple attack penalty. Subsequent attacks incur the multiple attack penalty as usual.

Hidden Chute.name: Hidden Chute
Hidden Chute.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|name:Remove Trapdoor|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to remove the trapdoor or lock it in position using a catch hidden inside the room's doorframe
Hidden Chute.hazarddescription: A trapdoor in the floor conceals a stone chute.

Ink Drowning Vats.name: Ink Drowning Vats
Ink Drowning Vats.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:40|name:Seal an Ink Spout|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to seal an ink spout, @Check[type:thievery|dc:48|name:Unlock a Door|traits:action:pick-a-lock] (master) to unlock a steel hatch door, or @Check[type:athletics|dc:45|name:Force Open a Door|traits:action:force-open] (master) to Force Open a steel hatch door
Ink Drowning Vats.hazarddescription: Steel hatch doors automatically lock shut in each of the four vats labeled J2. Four ink spouts (one per vat) jut through a narrow aperture in the ceiling of each vat, 20 feet above.
Ink Drowning Vats.reset: The trap can be reset by refilling the ink storage tanks above the vats.
Ink Drowning Vats.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action for each disabled ink spout. On each of the trap's actions, a spout pours ink, increasing the depth of the ink in that vat by 2 feet. Creatures standing in the ink are exposed to a dose of poison ink. Once the vat is full of ink, the trap stops using actions, but creatures in the vat might start drowning.

Inky Tendrils.name: Inky Tendrils
Inky Tendrils.disable:
@Check[type:athletics|dc:48|name:Disable Athletics] (legendary) or @Check[type:athletics|dc:45|name:Disable Acrobatics]{Acrobatics} (master) to tie one tentacle into a knot, rendering it useless, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 44) to counteract one tentacle.

The death of the Daemonic Rumormonger permanently dispels all the inky tendrils.
Inky Tendrils.hazarddescription: Six giant tentacles reach up from the ink lake, grabbing any foes in reach and dragging them underwater.
Inky Tendrils.routine: (6 actions) The hazard loses 1 action for every tentacle that is disabled or destroyed. The tentacles can combine their actions to use the hazard's Inky Imitator ability. A broken tentacle can still Strike, but it can't Grab. This hazard takes no multiple attack penalty.

Iron Maiden Trap.name: Iron Maiden Trap
Iron Maiden Trap.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:28|name:Disable Pressure Plate|traits:action:disable-a-device] to disable the pressure plate
Iron Maiden Trap.hazarddescription: A pressure plate hidden on the floor before an iron maiden causes the torture device to snap shut and trap the triggering creature inside.
Iron Maiden Trap.reset: The pressure plate must be reset manually.

Collapse.name: Collapse
Collapse.description:
Trigger The Iroran skeleton is critically hit

Effect The Iroran skeleton collapses into a pile of bones and the attack deals damage for a hit, rather than a critical hit.

The skeleton can reform in a standing position as an action, but until it does, it is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed}.

Flurry of Claws.name: Flurry of Claws
Flurry of Claws.description:
The Iroran skeleton makes two claw Strikes. If both hit the same creature, the damage is combined for the purpose of resistances and weaknesses.

The multiple attack penalty applies to the Strikes as normal.

Wall Run.name: Wall Run
Wall Run.description: The Iroran skeleton can Stride along vertical surfaces, such as walls, as long as it begins and ends its movement on a horizontal surface.

Water Step.name: Water Step
Water Step.description: The Iroran skeleton can Stride across liquid surfaces. If it ends its movement on a liquid surface, it falls in as normal.

Whirlwind Kick.name: Whirlwind Kick
Whirlwind Kick.description: The Iroran skeleton makes a single Strike and compares the result to the AC of all creatures within its reach, dealing damage to each creature hit.

Cheek Pouches.name: Cheek Pouches
Cheek Pouches.description: A ratfolk has stretchy cheek pouches that can store up to 1 cubic foot of objects. The ratfolk can remove or store an item using the Interact action. As long as the ratfolk has at least one object in its cheek pouches, its speech is noticeably difficult to understand.

Katar Specialist.name: Katar Specialist
Katar Specialist.description: Kekker has trained extensively with the katar blade. Any katar he wields gains the finesse trait.

Quick Stow.name: Quick Stow
Quick Stow.description:
Frequency once per round.

Effect Kekker stores one held item of light or negligible Bulk in his cheek pouches.

Swarming.name: Swarming
Swarming.description:
A ratfolk can end its movement in the same square as an ally that also has this ability.

Only two such creatures can share the same space.

Eschew Materials.name: Eschew Materials
Eschew Materials.description:
You can use clever workarounds to replicate the arcane essence of certain materials. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz]{Cast a Spell} that requires material components, you can provide these material components without a spell component pouch by drawing intricate replacement sigils in the air.

Unlike when providing somatic components, you still must have a hand completely free. This doesn't remove the need for any materials listed in the spell's cost entry.

Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.name: Kharnas's Lesser Glyph
Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.disable: Disable @Check[type:thievery|dc:46|name:Destroy Glyph|traits:action:disable-a-device] (legendary) to destroy the glyph, @Check[type:arcana|dc:42|name:Divert Glyph's Power] (master) to harmlessly divert the glyph's power, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th level; counteract DC 38) to counteract the glyph
Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.hazarddescription: A hidden glyph suddenly lights up and dominates the mind of any creature not bearing the sigil of Kharnas the Angel-Binder.
Kharnas's Lesser Glyph.reset: The glyph can affect two creatures before it deactivates for 5 minutes and automatically resets.

Scurry.name: Scurry
Scurry.description:
Trigger A creature ends its movement adjacent to Kolo

Effect Kolo Steps.

Upward Stab.name: Upward Stab
Upward Stab.description: Kolo's melee Strikes deal an extra 1d6 precision damage to Medium or larger creatures.

Lie-Master.name: Lie-Master
Lie-Master.publicNotes:
Glabrezus are looming behemoths who revel in the act of twisting mortal desires into their ultimate ruin, betraying and manipulating as easily as they breathe. Desires granted by a glabrezu always come to fruition in the most destructive way possible, turning a wish or hope into a potent and devastating act of betrayal-although the long-term repercussions are not always immediately apparent. For example, a struggling weapon smith might wish for fame and skill at their craft, only to find that their best patron is a cruel and sadistic murderer who uses the weapons in bloody sprees. Or a lonely widower might have his desire granted in the form of a lost love returned to "life" as a vampire. Glabrezus are nothing if not creative in addressing a mortal's needs.

These massive demons have enormous pincers and a pair of smaller humanoid arms sprouting from their chests, but their size belies their skill at magic, and they possess formidable innate spells. Treachery demons arise from the souls of mortals engaged in treason and deception.

Life Magnet.name: Life Magnet
Life Magnet.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:29|name:Deactivate Panel|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to deactivate the panel, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic};(4th level; counteract DC 22) to counteract the panel's magic
Life Magnet.hazarddescription: A magical magnet hidden behind a panel in the corner of the room pulls not metal but living creatures toward it, heedless of any obstacles in the way.
Life Magnet.reset: The trap deactivates and resets 1 minute after there are no creatures touching the iron bars.
Life Magnet.routine:
(1 action) The trap pulls up to four creatures that have already triggered its Magnetize the Living ability toward one of the far corners of the room, possibly pressing them into the iron bars. If all the iron bars between an affected creature and the magnetic panel remain intact, the creature takes [[/r {2d10+10}[bludgeoning]]]{2d10+10 bludgeoning damage} with a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25]{DC 25 basic Fortitude} save and is restrained on a failure (Escape DC 23).

If an iron bar has been broken, the creature takes [[/r {1d10+5}[bludgeoning]]]{1d10+5 bludgeoning damage} instead, and if two consecutive bars have been broken the creature takes no damage (but might still be restrained on a failed save).

Living Paints.name: Living Paints
Living Paints.disable: @Check[type:crafting|dc:41|name:Crafting Disable] (master) to mix the paints into bland, useless colors, @Check[type:thievery|dc:41|name:Thievery Disable] (legendary) to dismantle the animated brushes, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (8th level; counteract DC 41) to counteract the magic within the paint.
Living Paints.hazarddescription: A mass of brushes use magical paint to convert creatures into art.

Lusca.name: Lusca
Lusca.publicNotes: A lusca is a predatory sea monster that resembles a three-headed shark with the body of an octopus. Ferocious electrical storms usually herald a lusca's arrival; such violent bursts of electricity result from the creature's superconductive flesh, which allows the lusca to store energy from lightning strikes that it can then discharge at foes.

Maurrisa Jonne.name: Maurrisa Jonne
Maurrisa Jonne.senses: +2 status bonus to saves vs. Shove and Trip, +1 status bonus to saves vs. incapacitation effects

+1 status bonus on saves vs. incapacitat.name: +1 status bonus on saves vs. incapacitation effects

+2 status bonus on saves vs. shove.name: +2 status bonus on saves vs. shove

+2 status bonus on saves vs. trip.name: +2 status bonus on saves vs. trip

Duck and Weave.name: Duck and Weave
Duck and Weave.description:
Trigger A creature misses two consecutive melee Strikes against Maurrisa

Effect Maurrisa takes advantage of a flailing foe's opening. She can either Step 5 feet or make a melee Strike against the triggering creature.

Rabbit Punch.name: Rabbit Punch
Rabbit Punch.description:
Trigger Maurrisa can make an Attack of Opportunity

Effect Maurrisa chops her opponent on the back of the head or neck, possibly concussing them.

The target must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26] save. On a failure, the creature takes damage as if hit by Maurrisa's fist Strike, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}. On a critical failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} instead.

Supersonic Hearing.name: Supersonic Hearing
Supersonic Hearing.description: Mobana has spent years in close proximity to the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.k9BYXA4b7Z4Hy6lZ]{Deafening Music Box} in her possession and is immune to its effects. She also gains a +2 circumstance bonus against sonic effects and effects that impose the deafened condition

Swift Sneak.name: Swift Sneak
Swift Sneak.description: Mobana can move her full speed when @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneaking}.

Deny Advantage.name: Deny Advantage
Deny Advantage.description: Mobana isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} to creatures of 8th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.w6rMqmGzhUahdnA7]{Surprise Attack}.

Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger Mobana is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker they can see.

Effect Mobana gains a +2 ciurcumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Poison Weapon.name: Poison Weapon
Poison Weapon.description:
Requirements Mobana is wielding a piercing or slashing weapon and has a free hand.

Effect Mobana applies a poison to the weapon.

Quick Draw.name: Quick Draw
Quick Draw.description: Mobana Interacts to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
Mobana deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} to the assassin.

Mr. Snips.name: Mr. Snips
Mr. Snips.publicNotes: Traditionally crafted into the forms of giant suits of armor or powerful animals, iron golems are products of exquisite artistry and skill. Their articulated joints and sturdy armored bodies require great care and mathematical precision to craft, and regular cleaning and oiling ensure they don't rust over the ages. With proper care, iron golems can remain in good shape for thousands of years, being passed down for generations, as long as they aren't destroyed by meddlesome adventurers. In addition to their incredible strength, iron golems possess a potent toxic breath weapon that is often more than enough to dispatch entire groups of opponents.

Shared Diversion.name: Shared Diversion
Shared Diversion.description:
Trigger Another creature in the najra lizard's square succeeds at a Deception check to Create a Diversion

Effect The najra lizard automatically successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Creates a Diversion} against the same targets.

Najra Lizard Venom.name: Najra Lizard Venom
Najra Lizard Venom.description:
The creature is extremely thirsty and can't quench its thirst while poisoned

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21|traits:poison]

Maximum Duration 4 hours

Stage 1 [[/r {1d4}[poison]]]{1d4 poison damage}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}, and [[/r {1d4}]]{1d4 damage} that can't be recovered until the creature quenches its thirst (1 round)

Stage 2 as stage 1 (1 hour)

Najra Swarm Attack.name: Najra Swarm Attack
Najra Swarm Attack.description: The najra lizard's melee Strikes deal 1d6 precision damage to creatures sharing a square with more than one najra lizard.

Needling Stairs.name: Needling Stairs
Needling Stairs.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:33|name:Disable Stair Spring|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) on each stair to disable its spring, or deactivate the switch in area C8 to deactivate the whole trap. Cutting the wire on the topmost stair (>@Check[type:thievery|dc:35|name:Cut Wire on Top-Most Stair|traits:action:disable-a-device] to Disable the Device) that connects the staircase to the control switch prevents the control switch from turning the trap on or off.
Needling Stairs.hazarddescription: This staircase has springs in each step, which send poisoned needles shooting up through tiny holes in the wood when stepped on. Each step, 6 in total, takes up one 5-foot square.
Needling Stairs.reset: If deactivated via the switch, the trap can be reactivated with the switch in area C8.
Needling Stairs.routine: (1 action) The trap makes a separate poisoned needle Strike against each creature currently on an active step as 1 action. Because it is constantly jabbing needles up through any weight-bearing steps, the trap can also use its Bloody Feet free action to jab at a creature on one of the steps during that creature's turn.

Corpse Wallow.name: Corpse Wallow
Corpse Wallow.description: Theofalth zombie gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]{Fast Healing} 2 as long as it is in the Catacombs or another area with a high concentration of dead.

Rotting Aura.name: Rotting Aura
Rotting Aura.description:
10 feet, DC 24 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

The zombie emits an aura of rot and disease that causes wounds to fester and turn sour. Any living creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the Ofalth Zombie and is not at full Hit Points takes [[/r 1d6]] damage as its wounds fester.

Creatures that take a critical hit from the Ofalth Zombie also take this damage immediately.

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: The ofalth zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Bury in Offal.name: Bury in Offal
Bury in Offal.description:
The ofalth zombie makes a fling offal Strike and compares the attack roll result to the AC of any foes within the area of a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] emanating from the ofalth zombie. This counts as two attacks for the ofalth zombie's multiple attack penalty.

The ofalth zombie can't use Bury in Offal again until it moves at least 10 feet to a different space.

Wretched Weeps.name: Wretched Weeps
Wretched Weeps.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed2d8.success] every hour and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed2d8.success] every hour and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 day)

Pelmo.name: Pelmo
Pelmo.publicNotes:
The frontline fighters of goblin tribes prefer to fight in large groups-especially when they can outnumber their foes at least three to one.

These small humanoids have green or gray skin and large heads with wide ears. While some goblins are civilized and have worked hard to be considered upstanding members of humanoid communities, most are impetuous and vicious creatures who delight in wreaking havoc. These goblins think nothing of slaughtering livestock, stealing infants, or burning down a building purely for momentary delight. They revel in playing malicious tricks on taller humanoids, whom they call "longshanks."

Goblins are superstitious, with an intense awe of magic and a fascination with fire; goblins who master magic or fire earn great respect from their kin. Most other humanoids find it difficult to understand goblins' outlook: they hate canines but eagerly share their lairs with so-called "goblin dogs," they fearlessly attack larger creatures but are terrified of horses, and they despise vegetables yet consider pickles a delicacy. To a goblin, of course, these are all perfectly sensible life choices.

Goblin Scuttle.name: Goblin Scuttle
Goblin Scuttle.description:
Trigger A goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to Pelmo.

Effect Pelmo @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Steps}.

Combustible.name: Combustible
Combustible.description: The first time each round that a pickled punk takes fire damage, its fumes combust, dealing [[/r {5}[fire]]]{5 fire damage} to all other creatures within the area of its Suffocating Fumes aura.

Suffocating Fumes.name: Suffocating Fumes
Suffocating Fumes.description:
5 feet. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature that enters or begins its turn within the aura must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:14] save, or @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17] if the pickled punk is attached to the creature.

On a failed save, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and on a critical failure, it's also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 minute.

Attach.name: Attach
Attach.description:
When a pickled punk hits a target larger than itself, it uses bizarre excretions to adhere to that creature. This is similar to Grabbing the creature, but the pickled punk is not flat-footed, and it moves with that creature rather than holding it in place.

Each turn while attached, the pickled punk automatically deals the damage from its jaws Strike to the creature to which it's attached. It also wriggles about, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC as long as it's not also grabbed or restrained.

Plunger Chute.name: Plunger Chute
Plunger Chute.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:23|name:Jam the Trapdoor Shut|traits:action:disable-a-device] (expert) to jam the trapdoor shut or activate a hidden bypass switch by twisting a fitting on the gas lamp
Plunger Chute.hazarddescription: A trapdoor in the floor conceals a hidden chute, and a moving section of wall shoves victims into it.

Poisoned Dart Statue.name: Poisoned Dart Statue
Poisoned Dart Statue.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:34|name:Disable Trap|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) on the control panel deactivates the trap.
