Poisoned Dart Statue.hazarddescription: Countless poison darts fire from holes in the statues and walls of this hall.
Poisoned Dart Statue.reset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 minute.
Poisoned Dart Statue.routine: (1 action) The trap launches one dart against every creature in the hall as 1 action. Because it launches darts continuously, the trap can also use the Continuous Barrage free action (see below) to launch darts at each creature during that creature's turn. The trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty.
Poisoned Dart Statue.stealthdetails: (expert) or @Check[type:perception|dc:39|traits:action:seek] (master) to notice the control panel. Anyone specifically searching the name plate of Abresha Tallow-Hands locates the control panel automatically.

Prospecti Statue.name: Prospecti Statue
Prospecti Statue.publicNotes: As with any humanoid animated statues of Medium size, giant animated statues are used to guard locations of importance, but their increased size and power make them most useful in large vaults, spacious chambers, or outdoor locations. Animated objects of this strength and size are ideal for tasks and responsibilities usually performed by golems, and more powerful animated objects are thus all but unheard of.

Construct Armor.name: Construct Armor
Construct Armor.description: Like normal objects, a giant animated statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once a giant animated statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 22.

Stone Robes.name: Stone Robes
Stone Robes.description:
The Prospecti statue turns suddenly, causing its robes, which flow like fabric despite being as hard as stone, to swing about and damage opponents.

Creatures adjacent to the animated statue take [[/r {2d6+6}[bludgeoning]]]{2d6+6 bludgeoning damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:25|basic:true] save); on a critical failure, the creature is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone})

Pulping Golem.name: Pulping Golem
Pulping Golem.publicNotes: Traditionally crafted into the forms of giant suits of armor or powerful animals, iron golems are products of exquisite artistry and skill. Their articulated joints and sturdy armored bodies require great care and mathematical precision to craft, and regular cleaning and oiling ensure they don't rust over the ages. With proper care, iron golems can remain in good shape for thousands of years, being passed down for generations, as long as they aren't destroyed by meddlesome adventurers. In addition to their incredible strength, iron golems possess a potent toxic breath weapon that is often more than enough to dispatch entire groups of opponents.

Double Stab.name: Double Stab
Double Stab.description:
Requirements Ralso is wielding two piercing weapons

Frequency once per round

Effect Ralso makes two Strikes against a single creature within reach, one Strike per weapon.

These attacks count toward Ralso's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
Ralso deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
Deep Breath.description: A ravenile can hold their breath for 20 minutes.

Forced Regeneration.name: Forced Regeneration
Forced Regeneration.description:
Requirements The ravenile's regeneration is currently active

The ravenile regains [[/r {20}[healing]]] HP.

Furious Wallop.name: Furious Wallop
Furious Wallop.description:
Requirements The ravenile's regeneration is currently deactivated

Effect The ravenile makes a melee Strike.

This counts as two attacks for the ravenile's multiple attack penalty.

If this Strike hits, the ravenile deals an extra die of weapon damage and the target falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Rigged Cubby.name: Rigged Cubby
Rigged Cubby.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|name:Cut String|traits:action:disable-a-device] to cut the string without setting off the trap
Rigged Cubby.hazarddescription: A hidden string connected to precariously stacked bricks causes the cubby to collapse in on itself when the string is pulled.

Drain Wand.name: Drain Wand
Drain Wand.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements Scathka hasn't acted yet on their turn

Effect On their turn, Scathka casts one spell they've prepared and already cast this day without spending a spell slot. Scathka must still Cast the Spell and meet the spell's other requirements.

Throw Shadow Blade.name: Throw Shadow Blade
Throw Shadow Blade.description:
Requirement Scathka is wielding a dagger

Effect Scathka draws a shadowy glyph on the dagger's blade and flings it at a nearby foe. Scathka makes a ranged Strike with the dagger with the range increment to 30 feet.

If the Strike hits, it deals [[/r {8d6}[cold]]]{8d6 cold damage} (double damage on a critical success) and the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} until the end of its next turn (or [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} on a critical failure).

The dagger loses its shadowy magic as soon as the attack is resolved.

Deep Breath.name: Deep Breath
Deep Breath.description: A Shikwashim mercenary can hold their breath for 20 minutes.

Coordinated Distraction.name: Coordinated Distraction
Coordinated Distraction.description:
With a sharp whistle or wave of their hand, the mercenary distracts an opponent so one of the mercenary's allies can land a clean blow.

The mercenary chooses a target and an ally, both of whom must be within 30 feet of the mercenary. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} against the first Strike the mercenary's ally makes on its next turn; if the ally doesn't Strike that target, the effect is lost.

Depending on how the mercenary distracts their foe, this action gains either the auditory or visual trait.

Human Hunter.name: Human Hunter
Human Hunter.description: A Shikwashim mercenary's multiple attack penalty for attacks against humans is -3 (-2 with an agile weapon) on their second attack per turn or -6 (-4 with an agile weapon) on their third or subsequent attack per turn.

Powerful Swipe.name: Powerful Swipe
Powerful Swipe.description:
The Shikwashim mercenary makes a melee Strike. If it hits, it deals an extra die of damage.

This counts as two attacks for the mercenary's multiple attack penalty.

Terrain Advantage.name: Terrain Advantage
Terrain Advantage.description: Non-lizardfolk creatures in difficult terrain and non-lizardfolk creatures that are in water and lack a Swim speed are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} to a Shikwashim mercenary.

Compression.name: Compression
Compression.description: When a shredskin successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.kMcV8e5EZUxa6evt]{Squeezes}, it moves through the tight space at full speed. Narrow confines are not difficult terrain for a shredskin.

Control Body.name: Control Body
Control Body.description:
Requirements The shredskin is adjacent to a Medium or Small humanoid-shaped corpse

Effect The shredskin wraps itself around the corpse and takes control of the host body. While controlling a host, the shredskin uses the host's Speed but its own attacks, and it loses its Grab and Enshroud abilities.

Attacks that target the shredskin while it controls a body deal half of the damage to the shredskin and half of the damage to the host body. Attacks that target an area deal damage to both the shredskin and host body normally.

The shredskin can release the host body as a free action at the start of its turn. If the host is destroyed, the shredskin automatically releases the body and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} for 1 round. A Medium corpse typically has 15 hit points, while a Small corpse typically has 10 Hit Points.

Creatures can notice that a corpse is controlled by a shredskin by succeeding a Perception check against the shredskin's Deception DC.

Enshroud.name: Enshroud
Enshroud.description:
Requirements The shredskin is grabbing a creature

Effect The shredskin attempts to pin the creature and wrap itself around the creature like a shirt. The shredskin rolls an Athletics check against the creature's Fortitude DC.

On a success, the creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} and the shredskin can take control of the creature as if using Control Body.

At the start of its turn, the shredskin can automatically Constrict the enshrouded creature as a free action.

An enshrouded creature can attempt a DC 16 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} check to break free (DC 18 if the shredskin critically succeeded its Athletics check to Enshroud).

equipment-Victor's Medallion from the Ch.name: Victor's Medallion from the Challenge of Sky and Heaven

Flurry of Blows.name: Flurry of Blows
Flurry of Blows.description:
Shristi makes two unarmed Strikes. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purposes of resistances and weaknesses. He applies his multiple attack penalty to the Strikes normally.

As it has the flourish trait, Shristi can use Flurry of Blows only once per turn.

Heaven's Thunder.name: Heaven's Thunder
Heaven's Thunder.description:
Frequency twice per day

Effect With a loud shout, Shristi unleashes his ki as a crackling shroud of thunder and lightning that engulfs his body. Until the end of his next turn, Shristi's unarmed Strikes and Strikes with weapons that have the monk trait deal an additional 3 electricity damage and 3 sonic damage.

Sky and Heaven Stance.name: Sky and Heaven Stance
Sky and Heaven Stance.description:
Shristi enters a combat stance perfected by past champions of the Challenge of Sky and Heaven. While in this stance, the only Strikes Shristi can make are skyward slash unarmed attacks. These deal 1d10 slashing damage; are in the brawling group; and have the nonlethal, unarmed, and versatile P traits.

While in Sky and Heaven Stance, Shristi gains resistance 2 to electricity and sonic damage.

Exorcism.name: Exorcism
Exorcism.description:
Mental damage ignores a siege shard's hardness.

Additionally, proving the siege shard's generative conflict is over with the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Ma93dpT4K7JbP9gu]{Prove Peace} activity reverts the creature to ordinary stone.

Surreptitious Siege.name: Surreptitious Siege
Surreptitious Siege.description: While a siege shard is embedded within a structure while using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.vh1RpbWfqdNC4L3P]{Meld into Stone}, the structure and all objects within it take twice as long to repair.

Overwhelming Anguish.name: Overwhelming Anguish
Overwhelming Anguish.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The siege shard emits a disorienting psychic blast. All creatures within a 15 feet emanation take [[/r {4d6}[mental]]]{4d6 mental damage} (@Check[type:will|dc:20|basic:true] save).

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description:
When a siege shard is destroyed within 100 feet of a structure, it reforms after [[/br 2d4 #days]] days within the nearest structure, fully healed.

A siege shard within a structure can permanently destroyed by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.adventure-specific-actions.QW2gYIKce3W31xXf]{Prove Peace} activity.

Distracting Shadows.name: Distracting Shadows
Distracting Shadows.description: Skebs can use creatures that are at least one size larger than themself as cover for the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} actions.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
Skebs deals 1d6 extra precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
When attacking a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} creature, the Skinsaw murderer deals [[/r {1d6}[precision]]]{1d6 additional precision damage}.

When the monster Strikes a creature that has the flat-footed condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

Twin Takedown.name: Twin Takedown
Twin Takedown.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirement You are wielding two melee weapons, each in a different hand.

Effect You swiftly attack your hunted prey with both weapons. Make two Strikes against a creature, one with each of the required weapons. If both hit the same creature, combine their damage for the purpose of its resistances and weaknesses. Apply your multiple attack penalty to each Strike normally.

Wire Catch.name: Wire Catch
Wire Catch.description:
Every Skinsaw seamer keeps a sewing needle attached to a loop of thick silk, wrapped loosely around their hand not holding a weapon, which they can use in combat to snag or disarm attackers

Trigger A creature hits the seamer with a melee Strike

Effect The seamer attempts an Athletics check to either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.i95kcGLIQKOTsnv6]{Grapple} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.ooiO59Ch2QaebOmc]{Disarm} the triggering creature.

Flay.name: Flay
Flay.description:
Requirements The Skinsaw seamer dealt damage with a melee weapon other than its war razor with their last action

Effect The seamer makes a war razor Strike against the same creature that they just damaged. On a hit, the seamer slices a strip of flesh from the target and deals @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d6.success] in addition to the war razor's usual damage.

Quick Stitch.name: Quick Stitch
Quick Stitch.description:
Requirements The Skinsaw seamer is currently grappling a creature

Effect The seamer stitches a piece of cloth to the creature's arm, face, or leg, potentially hindering it. The creature must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:26|traits:damaging-effect] saving throw; if the seamer has already successfully used their Flay ability against the creature within the past minute, the creature's save result is one degree of success worse.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes [[/r {1d4}[piercing]]]{1d4 piercing damage}.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} (seamer's choice). This effect lasts until the creature spends a single action to tear out the stitching, which deals [[/r {1d6}[piercing]]]{1d6 piercing damage} to it.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}, or flat-footed (seamer's choice). This effect lasts until the creature spends 2 actions to tear out the stitching, which deals [[/r {2d6}[piercing]]]{2d6 piercing damage} to it.

Pest Haven.name: Pest Haven
Pest Haven.description:
The rotting hides and molding straw stuffing of skitterstitches are ideal nesting grounds for vermin and insect swarms.

Any animal swarm sharing a space with a skitterstitch gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]{Fast Healing} 3.

Additionally, if a creature deals at least 10 piercing or slashing damage to the skitterstitchstitch, the swarm can use its swarming bites Strike (or similar attack) against the attacker as a reaction.

Spider Swarm Host.name: Spider Swarm Host
Spider Swarm Host.description: Skitterstitches host a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.KpxhSWRIhG7ns5NA]{Spider Swarm} within themselves, which erupts out when the Skitterstitch is destroyed

Flay.name: Flay
Flay.description: The skitterstitch makes a blade Strike against an animal or humanoid. On a success, the skitterstitch slices a long strip of flesh from the target; if the skitterstitch dealt damage, it deals an additional [[/r {1d6+4}[persistent,bleed]]] @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}.

Skitterstitch Venom.name: Skitterstitch Venom
Skitterstitch Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:23|traits:poison]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {1d10}[poison]]]{1d10 poison damage}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {1d10}[poison]]]{1d10 poison damage}, flat-footed, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (1 round)

Stitch Skin.name: Stitch Skin
Stitch Skin.description:
Requirements The skitterstitch hasn't used this ability since the last time it successfully used its Flay ability

Effect The skitterstitch sews flayed flesh to its body to seal tears and rents. The skitterstitch regains 8 Hit Points.

Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil).name: Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil)
Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil).disable: @Check[type:perception|dc:18|name:Notice the Trap's Magic|traits:action:seek] to notice the trap's magic and avoid stepping on the floor outside the circle, followed by @Check[type:thievery|dc:21|name:Break Summoning Circle|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to break the circle or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd level; counteract DC 23) to counteract the rune
Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil).hazarddescription: A summoning circle inlaid into the room's floor detects living creatures and summons a violent devil.
Summoning Rune (Barbazu Devil).reset: The trap resets each day at dawn.

Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat).name: Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat)
Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat).disable: @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:22|name:Approach Rune] (trained) to approach without triggering the trap, followed by @Check[type:thievery|dc:22|name:Erase Summoning Rune|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) to erase the rune or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd level; counteract DC 20) to counteract the rune
Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat).hazarddescription: An invisible cloud of magical sensors detects living creatures in the room and summons fire elementals to slay the creatures.
Summoning Rune (Cinder Rat).reset: The trap resets each day at dawn.

Supplicant Statues.name: Supplicant Statues
Supplicant Statues.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:34|name:Disable Statue Rollers|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to disable a specific statue's rollers, or @Check[type:thievery|dc:39|name:Disable Trap (Control Panel)|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) on the control panel in A4 deactivates the whole trap. For each statue disabled, the trap loses 1 action from its routine and the DC for its predictive impediment ability decreases by 4. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (7th level, counteract DC 32) doesn't harm the statues but removes the predictive impediment ability. Breaking the control panel prevents the trap from resetting.
Supplicant Statues.hazarddescription: Six statues rapidly slide around the room on rollers, slowing down intruders and striking at them with spring-loaded sword arms.
Supplicant Statues.reset: The trap deactivates and resets one minute after the room is empty.
Supplicant Statues.routine: (6 actions) On the trap's initiative, each functioning statue slides up to 40 feet around the room and makes a statue shortsword Strike against an adjacent creature. The trap doesn't take a multiple attack penalty, and the statues' movements don't trigger reactions.

Shadow Step.name: Shadow Step
Shadow Step.description:
The svartalfar killer fades into shadow, Strides up to twice its Speed, and reforms.

This movement doesn't trigger reactions, but the svartalfar killer must begin and end in an area of dim light or darkness.

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
A svartalfar killer deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Spell-Imbued Blade.name: Spell-Imbued Blade
Spell-Imbued Blade.description:
The svartalfar killer chooses @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.gISYsBFby1TiXfBt]{Acid Splash}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.O9w7r4BKgPogYDDe]{Produce Flame}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.J7Y7tl0bbdz7TcCc]{Ray of Enfeeblement}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.r3NeUnsgt9mS03Sn]{Shocking Grasp} and makes a melee Strike.

If the svartalfar killer hits, they cast the chosen spell through the weapon at the same target. The spell's attack roll is the same result as the Strike.

Obscuring Grab.name: Obscuring Grab
Obscuring Grab.description: While the tenome is Grabbing a creature, all other creatures are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to the tenome.

Bone Drink.name: Bone Drink
Bone Drink.description:
Requirement The tenome has a creature grabbed or restrained

Effect The tenome makes a jaws Strike against the grabbed or restrained creature. If the Strike hits, the creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (or the value of the creature's drained condition increases by 1 if it already has a drained value, to a maximum of drained 4).

The tenome regains [[/r {1d8}[healing]]]{1d8 Hit Points} each time it uses Bone Drink.

Burst of Speed.name: Burst of Speed
Burst of Speed.description:
The tenome Strides twice, Steps twice, or Steps and Strides (in either order).

It cannot use Burst of Speed again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Terrifying Gaze.name: Terrifying Gaze
Terrifying Gaze.description:
1 or 2 actions

A tenome can gaze at a creature within 30 feet by presenting one of its eyes. The target must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}. If the tenome uses 2 actions and presents both of its eyes, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} if it fails the save.

A creature that successfully saves is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Teraphant.name: Teraphant
Teraphant.senses: emotion sense 120 尺, 昏暗视觉

Emotion Sense 120 feet.name: Emotion Sense 120 feet
Emotion Sense 120 feet.description: A teraphant can sense the emotions of creatures within 120 feet as an imprecise sense. Emotion sense is a precise sense against creatures under an emotion effect. A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm Emotions} can't be noticed via emotion sense.

Empathetic Response.name: Empathetic Response
Empathetic Response.description:
Trigger A creature within 60 feet of the teraphant is targeted by a spell or ability with the emotion trait

Effect The teraphant also benefits from the spell or effect, as though it were an additional target for 1 minute or until the triggering spell or ability ends.

Impale.name: Impale
Impale.description:
Requirement The teraphant has a creature grabbed

Effect The teraphant slams the creature onto one of its horns. The target must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:27|basic:true] save or suffer [[/r {3d6+9}[piercing]]]{3d6+9 piercing damage} and @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d6.success] ([[/r {6d6+18}[piercing]]]{6d6+18 piercing damage} on a critical failure).

Psychokinetic Trumpet.name: Psychokinetic Trumpet
Psychokinetic Trumpet.description:
The teraphant lets out a loud trumpet that deals [[/r {8d8}[mental]]]{8d8 mental damage} (@Check[type:will|dc:27|basic:true] save) in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30]. A creature that fails its save is also pushed 15 feet (30 feet on a critical failure).

If a pushed creatures strikes a solid barrier, it takes [[/r {3d6}[bludgeoning]]]{3d6 bludgeoning damage} and stops.

The teraphant can't use Psychokinetic Trumpet again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

Grabbing Trunk.name: Grabbing Trunk
Grabbing Trunk.description: A Medium or smaller creature hit by the teraphant's trunk is grabbed. If the teraphant moves, it can bring the grabbed creature along with it.

The Inkmaster.name: The Inkmaster
The Inkmaster.publicNotes:
Shemhazians rise from the souls of torturers and those who reveled in mutilating the physical bodies of their victims. Standing 35 feet tall, a shemhazian is well equipped with a wide range of talons, claws, and fangs to continue inflicting such torments on those it encounters.

Shemhazians delight in visiting torment upon mortals, of course, but more than most demons, these fiends revel in sharing the pain with their own kind. Other demons fear and hate shemhazians for this reason, with only the most powerful willing to work with a shemhazian to achieve a shared goal. Even then, the shemhazian is always on the watch for an opportunity to bring pain and suffering to its allies along with any foe.

The Laughing Fiend's Greeting.name: The Laughing Fiend's Greeting
The Laughing Fiend's Greeting.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:44|name:Disable Thievery] (legendary) to obscure or mar the magical runes set into the mural, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (9th level; counteract DC 42) to counteract the mural
The Laughing Fiend's Greeting.hazarddescription: Subtle but deadly magical runes link this mural to Kharnas's master. Good- or neutral-aligned creatures who examine the mural witness the castle's drawbridge silently descend, revealing an endless darkness.

The Winder.name: The Winder
The Winder.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:50|name:Deactivate System|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to deactivate the system, or @Check[type:athletics|dc:40|name:Jam Gears] (legendary) to jam the gears for 1 round
The Winder.hazarddescription: A large metallic arm, 20 feet long, is set into the floor. It rotates around the room to wind up nearby clockwork creatures.
The Winder.reset: The Winder resets as soon as no creatures remain in the room.
The Winder.routine: (1, 2, or 4 actions, depending on the encounter's threat level) The Winder uses each of its actions to Wind clockwork assassins in the room, starting with inactive ones.

Motion Sense 60 feet.name: Motion Sense 60 feet
Motion Sense 60 feet.description: Tyrroicese can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

Pseudopod Burst.name: Pseudopod Burst
Pseudopod Burst.description:
Tyrroicese makes up to three pseudopod strikes, each against a different creature.

Tyrroicese's multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after all these attacks are made.

Rallying Call.name: Rallying Call
Rallying Call.description:
When Tyrroicese subsumed Corporal Quordein, it gained a perverted form of the commander's ability to rally allies.

The first time Tyrroicese uses this ability, it summons an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.uQBOJfjtzEXvpLQz]{Ochre Jelly}, which leaks out of the ceiling of area D13 and drops to the floor to join the fight, siding with Tyrroicese.

Thereafter, when Tyrroicese uses this ability, any oozes within 60 feet become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round (the oozes can use their extra action only to Stride) and, if they're not allied with the agents, the oozes ally themselves with Tyrroicese.

Stretching Step.name: Stretching Step
Stretching Step.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Tyrroicese forcefully extends a sticky pseudopod, plants it on a wall within 45 feet, and retracts the muscle.

Tyrroicese springs over to a space adjacent to the wall, moving through the intervening squares as normal but ignoring any difficult or greater difficult terrain.

Subsume.name: Subsume
Subsume.description:
Tyrroicese lifts an adjacent dying creature with its pseudopods and subsumes that creature into its own oozy flesh. The subsumed creature's dying value does not increase, though it can't decrease either.

Tyrroicese regains 30 HP and also gains the ability to use one or two of the subsumed creature's special abilities or feats, subject to the GM's discretion.

A creature adjacent to Tyrroicese can extract a subsumed creature by spending 2 actions to attempt a @Check[type:athletics|dc:29|name:Extract Subsumed Creature] check.

On a success, the subsumed creature is pulled from Tyrroicese and falls into the nearest available space.

Kiss.name: Kiss
Kiss.description: The vargouille kisses an adjacent creature that's asleep, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, exposing it to the vargouille transformation disease.

Shriek.name: Shriek
Shriek.description:
The vargouille shrieks, its scream so terrible that all non-vargouilles within 60 feet must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 3 rounds.

The effect ends early for a creature if the vargouille moves out of sight, moves farther than 60 feet from the creature, or attacks the creature with its fangs.

After attempting its save, a creature is immune to that particular vargouille's Shriek for 24 hours.

Vargouille Transformation.name: Vargouille Transformation
Vargouille Transformation.description:
Exposing the victim to sunlight or any light spell of 3rd level or higher pauses the progression of the disease until the victim is no longer in light.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18]

Stage 1 carrier with no effect ([[/br 1d6 #hours]] hours)

Stage 2 victim's hair falls out ([[/br 1d6 #hours]] hours)

Stage 3 victim's ears grow into leathery wings, tentacles sprout on the chin and scalp, and the teeth become long, pointed fangs (1 day)

Stage 4 victim's mind regresses to a vicious and unintelligent shell of its former self ([[/br 1d6 #hours]] hours)

Stage 5 victim's head breaks free of the body (which dies) and becomes a new vargouille

Vargouille Venom.name: Vargouille Venom
Vargouille Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:18|name:Vargouile Venom]

Stage 1 Damage the victim has taken from vargouille fangs can't be healed magically.

Once all vargouille fang damage has been healed nonmagically, the poison ends.

Vaultbreaker Ooze.name: Vaultbreaker Ooze
Vaultbreaker Ooze.senses: 运动感知 60 尺; treasure sense (模糊感官) 30 尺

Motion Sense 60 feet.name: Motion Sense 60 feet
Motion Sense 60 feet.description: A vaultbreaker ooze can sense nearby motion through vibration and air movement.

Treasure Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet.name: Treasure Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet
Treasure Sense (Imprecise) 30 feet.description: The vaultbreaker ooze's metallic plasm alerts it to the presence of metals with the precious trait (including gold and platinum) within 30 feet.

Metallify.name: Metallify
Metallify.description:
Trigger A creature Strikes the vaultbreaker ooze

Effect The ooze's outer plasm hardens into a protective shell of precious metals. Until the start of its next turn, it gains resistance 5 to physical damage (except adamantine), it has a -5-foot penalty to its Speed, and its pseudopod Strikes gain the versatile S or P weapon trait.

Engulf.name: 包卷 Engulf
Engulf.description:
@Check[type:reflex|dc:23|traits:damaging-effect], [[/r {2d8+9}[acid]]]{2d8+9 acid damage}, Escape DC 23, Rupture 14 (19 when using Metallify)

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Engulf]

Form Tool.name: Form Tool
Form Tool.description: The vaultbreaker ooze instinctually shapes its pseudopod into a key, lockpick, or tool required to bypass a locking mechanism; it uses this pseudopod as thieves' tools to Pick a Lock or Disable a Device.

Bullyrag Beatdown.name: Bullyrag Beatdown
Bullyrag Beatdown.description: Whenever the gang tough makes a successful melee Strike against a frightened creature, the Strike deals an extra weapon die of damage.

Frightening Critical.name: Frightening Critical
Frightening Critical.description: When the gang tough's Strike with a bludgeoning weapon is a critical hit and deals damage, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Scraping Clamor.name: Scraping Clamor
Scraping Clamor.description:
The Washboard Dog scrapes their weapon up and down their washboard shield, making such a clatter that it's hard to hear anything over the din. Until the beginning of the Washboard Dog tough's next turn, all creatures within 30 feet gain a +1 circumstance bonus to any saves to resist auditory spells or abilities.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.wcNGbhwn3AuamtsX]{Effect: Scraping Clamor}

Water Elemental Vessel.name: Water Elemental Vessel
Water Elemental Vessel.publicNotes: Spellcasters create elemental vessels by harvesting raw elemental energy and then binding it within a specially enchanted magic circle to grant it life.

Water Elemental Vessel (I2).name: Water Elemental Vessel (I2)
Water Elemental Vessel (I2).publicNotes: Spellcasters create elemental vessels by harvesting raw elemental energy and then binding it within a specially enchanted magic circle to grant it life.

Waxworks Onslaught Trap.name: Waxworks Onslaught Trap
Waxworks Onslaught Trap.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:43|name:Drain Wax from a Tub|traits:action:disable-a-device] (master) to drain the wax from a tub or @Check[type:athletics|dc:45|name:Push Through Wax|traits:action:force-open] (master) to push through the wax blocking a sealed door and escape (other creatures must push their own way through, as the wax reseals)
Waxworks Onslaught Trap.hazarddescription: Four huge tubs containing congealed wax, enchanted to melt and envelop unwary intruders, each sit atop a cold fire.
Waxworks Onslaught Trap.reset: The trap deactivates and resets after 1 hour. At that time, the wax in the tubs cools and congeals, and any wax elsewhere in the room magically goes back into the tubs.
Waxworks Onslaught Trap.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn per drained or destroyed tub. On each action, a different tub spews hot wax at a random creature in the room, dealing 3d12 fire damage to the target and all adjacent creatures (@Check[type:reflex|dc:35|basic:true]). On a failure or critical failure, the creature is also encased in hot wax. A creature that starts its turn encased in wax takes 8d12 fire damage and is immobilized until it Escapes the hardening wax (DC 35). Each turn it remains encased, the damage dealt by the hot wax decreases by 2d12 but the DC to Escape increases by 2 (minimum 0 damage, maximum DC 43). A creature that can't get free from the wax might suffocate.

equipment-Key to the Skinsaw Sanctum Vau.name: Key to the Skinsaw Sanctum Vault

Bloody Sneak Attack.name: Bloody Sneak Attack
Bloody Sneak Attack.description: Any creature taking @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage} is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} against the Skinner's attacks. When attacking a flat-footed creature, the Skinner deals an additional [[/r {2d6}[precision]]]{2d6 precision damage}.

Chain Expert.name: Chain Expert
Chain Expert.description: The Skinner can effectively wield abnormally long spiked chains and can do so using only one hand.

Chain Up.name: Chain Up
Chain Up.description:
Requirements The Skinner has an adjacent creature grabbed with her spiked chain

Effect The Skinner attempts an Athletics check against the grabbed creature's Reflex save DC. On a success, the Skinner knots her chain around the grabbed creature, which becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} (Escape DC = 10 + the result of the Skinner's Athletics check); on a critical success, the creature also falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Regardless of whether the Skinner succeeds, she drops the chain.

Flay.name: Flay
Flay.description: Whenever the Skinner makes a successful cleaver Strike against a grabbed creature, she also deals @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d6.success] (or @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed2d6.success] on a critical hit).

Hook and Flay.name: Hook and Flay
Hook and Flay.description:
Requirements The Skinner has a creature grabbed with her spiked chain

Effect The Skinner pulls the creature into the nearest open adjacent square and makes a cleaver Strike against the creature.

Dubious Shifting.name: Dubious Shifting
Dubious Shifting.description:
The zrukbat assumes the shape of any Small object or ornamentation, although the zrukbat's mimicked objects usually have unrealistic or suspicious quirks.

This doesn't change the zrukbat's size but can alter their coloration and visual appearance.

They have an automatic result of 23 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as the mimicked object.

Go for the Eyes.name: Go for the Eyes
Go for the Eyes.description:
The zrukbat flies up to its Speed and makes a claw Strike at the end of its move.

If the claw attack hits, the target must succeed on a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:15] saving throw or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round (or blinded for 1 minute on a critical failure). If the Strike was a critical hit, the target's save result is one degree of success worse.
